meanings.definition: A person or thing that is similar or analogous to another.
meanings.sent1: My best friend is my parallel, always understanding me.
meanings.sent2: The relationship between a teacher and a student can be seen as a parallel.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how my cat seems to be my parallel in laziness.
meanings.sent4: The two siblings were like parallels, always mirroring each other's actions.
meanings.sent5: The parallel between the two characters in the story made it easy to relate to both.

meanings.definition: Lines that are always the same distance apart and never touch.
meanings.sent1: The parallel lines on the road guide the cars in the same direction.
meanings.sent2: In geometry, parallel lines never intersect no matter how far they extend.
meanings.sent3: The parallel lines on the paper made it easy to draw straight shapes.
meanings.sent4: The train tracks ran parallel to each other, never crossing paths.
meanings.sent5: The architect carefully measured to ensure the walls had perfect parallels.
